alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:03AM CST until February 20 at 1:24AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Missouri... Current River near Doniphan affecting Ripley County. .Heavy rain from Thursday`s rainfall, along with snowmelt and rainfall upstream in the Current River Basin will cause a sharp rise on the Current River at Doniphan tonight into Saturday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Current River near Doniphan. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
